titles.title: Relating to consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3009) to extend the Andean Trade Preference Act, to grant additional trade benefits under that Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-518, by Mr. Reynolds.

Provides that H.R. 3009 and the Senate amendment thereto, shall be taken from the Speaker's table and agreed to with the amendment printed in the report (House Report No. 107-518). Also provides that the House shall be considered to have insisted on its amendment to the Senate amendment and requested a conference with the Senate thereon.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 176.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 450.
DEBATE - The House continued with debate on H. Res. 450.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 215, 1 Present (Roll no. 264).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/19/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 3009 (trade adjustment assistance, Andean trade promotion and trade preference expansion, and U.S. Customs Service reauthorization). Agrees to the Senate amendment with an amendment printed in the accompanying report of the Committee on Rules.
